project.name: coldspot-safety-router
project.tagline: Real-time threat analysis and safest routing (City/County/State/Country) with optional Zora NFT threat-report minting.

license.note: Use Apache-2.0 if patent grant is desired; use MIT for simplest permissive licensing.

core_goals: Keep Huntsville City scope as first-class MVP but architect for nationwide scaling.
Add geographic scope support: city, county, state, country.
Backend provides cascading context: City includes County+State+Country; County includes State+Country; State includes Country.
Frontend supports selecting scope + querying appropriate endpoint.
Do not fearmonger: score derived from corroborated sources; incidents expire if unconfirmed.

scoring.note: Weights match the current UI narrative. Normalize and clamp to 11.

nft.note: NFT minting is optional; at minimum generate Zora-ready metadata JSON + SVG image data URIs.

collection.name: Coldspot Safety Router - Location Threat Reports

non_goals: Do not ship private/regulated 911 CAD data without explicit legal/partner agreements.
Do not store PII (exact home addresses) by default; prefer coarse geofences for public outputs.
agent_operating_rules: Make changes as small, reviewable commits (5-15 files per PR max).
Prefer typed JS/TS; if plain JS, include JSDoc types for API response shapes.
All endpoints must return deterministic JSON schema; include 'scope' and 'context' blocks.
Front-end must degrade gracefully when sources are down.
